head.title: A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. - Page #39

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #39 of 50 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Sent Martin & Rangé to Sett nets at a little river below the little Islands[.] Fine weather[.]
Friday 28th[.] Rangé & Martin returned without having to Ke[ep] any fish[.] [T]hey Shot a Pichoux[.] Sent Martin to Sleep at another little river with nets[.]

Satury 29th[.] Martin brought 10 Ps of Fish, only two of which were taken in the nets the others at the lines[.] The men pressed 12 Packs[.] An Indian from above brought 18 Skins of furrs of debts & traded 7 more[.] Sent the little Slave to Hunt[.] Gave him 4 meas: Ammn[.]

Sunday 30th[.] Arrived Capot Rouge & Levrier with their respective bands to the number of 18 men & Boys[.] Gave out bits Tobo & Drams[.] These gave 247 Skins of Peltries for debts & Traded 136 more, besides 9 Skins in Br Tails, 1 Dressed moose deer Skin, & a Lodge containing 6 Dressed Skins[.] Out of the above furrs Capot Rouge gave 55 for his Share & the Lodge which is new & valued at 10 Skins[.] Gave these two great men each a foot of Tobo & 8 Quarts mixed rum ans an encouragement that they should Keep above & look for Beaver – forbid them entirely to work any other Kind of Furrs[.] They made a large Harangue, the heads of which, is a demand of plenty Irons next fall & all other necessaries, that they have found plenty of Beaver & are well inclined to work them – that they have never complained of want of Goods, no never asked a Great supply because they had not seen beaver[.] This year it is quite otherwise we are bold to ask, for we are sure to pay & Trade[.] I gave them all the assurances required & was honoured so far as to obtain a promise from them that altho' they should meet with the Red Knives, they will not run away & come down again, they have their families & are determined to pass the summer & ensuing winter[.]

Mony 31st[.] Gave out Credits & Sent off all the Indians except two young men who remains here to help me up to the red Knife river where the natives expressed a desire that I Should go that I might recieve the Provisions in the Summer[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
